story_txt:
An open and shut case for the future of helmets  People are cycling more than ever. In Europe and the USA more bicycles are now being sold than cars! And more and more cities around the world are introducing cycle rental schemes.It’s inevitable that as more people take to the road on a bicycle, more people will have accidents. When head meets road, vehicle or pavement without a helmet on it’s generally pretty messy… and sometimes fatal!When it's not fatal the injuries caused by brain damage can often be too awful to contemplate. Victims of brain injuries often spend years in a coma unable to communicate in any way or they lose the ability to live normal lives and can need constant care. More often than not, head injuries affect not just the victim but whole families.My campaign is to develop and manufacture Morpher, a new kind of helmet that folds flat so that it's easy to carry around when one isn't actually on a bicycle.   STOP PRESS: The Evening Standard, London's evening newspaper, reported on Thursday that after a cycling accident in Spitalfields on Monday night, 27-year-old Claire Pepper's head became trapped under a VW Golf. “If I had not been wearing my helmet I would have died,” she said. And, with five cycling deaths on London’s roads in the past nine days, many of us want all the protection we can get.Popular Science Magazine's Safety Invention of the yearMorpher literally folds in half when not in use. It will slide away into a bag with little more fuss than a laptop. With Morpher, cyclists will find it easier to always have a helmet at hand. More helmets =  fewer head injuries and fatalities.Help Morpher happen sooner - pick a perk nowSome people have asked me why we have quoted our perks in US$ and not UK£. The answer is that I had to pick one or other currency and as most funds are likely to come from the good old US of A I thought that Dollars would be more appropriate. Currently £1.00 is worth around $1.29. Which means that a rough value of our perks is as follows:$100= £77.47                  $150 = £116.20                    $300 = £232.41Don't forget to add your postage!   Morpher is the world’s first fold-flat helmet. Morpher folds & unfolds quickly and simply, so it's perfect for cyclists who want to carry a helmet more easily. Patented worldwide, Morpher has been designed to exceed all relevant safety standards. Morpher is initially aimed at all cyclists; especially those urban ones who find normal helmets cumbersome to carry around all day. Eventually it will also be marketed to other users of sports safety helmets (skiers, skaters, snow boarders, hockey players, horse riders etc). Morpher's flat profile will also allow innovative selling methods, such as vending machines placed by major bicycle hire points. Morpher aims to give the world an unprecedented ease of access to cycle safety. At Morpher we also believe in a greener planet, so we've ensured that our helmets and their components are made from recyclable materials.    Check out the image gallery for more images of Morpher People love Morpher. Even as a prototype, it's already won three major international innovation awards.                  I'm Jeff, an inventor from the UK. I'm also a keen urban cyclist. I’ve been working hard to develop this product for the past 2 years.I have been involved with successful innovation and new product development for many years and have worked with hundreds of inventors over the past 20 years helping them to get their ideas made and their products to market.I am utilising everything I've learned as well as the skills of the team that I’ve built around me to ensure that this product is an incredible improvement over existing technologies. I am chairman of the Judging panel for the World Innovation Awards that are held annually in London and I really believe that with my experience I have what it takes to make this product work. Well.MORE ABOUT THE INVENTOR: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeff_Woolf    After I came up with the idea for Morpher I knew that I needed to get some top quality Industrial Design done, so I contacted some of the world's leading industrial design companies to ask them to tender for the project. After careful consideration, I chose Therefore Limited, as, rather unsurprisingly, they came up with by far the best solutions. Therefore work with great companies like Braun, Asus, Samsonite, Tom Tom, etc.,and were the design house responsible for the groundbreaking Psion Series 5 PDA range.Therefore were also responsible for the design and development of the GravityLight, which raised $399,590.00 on Indiegogo in a campaign that was oversubscribed 727%. They are World Class designers and their work on Morpher has been incredible. I have been involved with manufacturers and injection moulders for many years and after visiting and getting manufacturing quotations from dozens of helmet manufacturers I have carefully selected Strategic Sports Ltd to manufacture Morpher.They are the world’s leading OEM helmet manufacturer who are determined to make this a fantastically safe and effective product. They make helmets for most of the world’s leading brands.If you own a cycle helmet, the chances are that it’s one of theirs.They are an amazing company that treat their staff incredibly well. They provide homes, schooling, English lessons, food, sporting facilities, loads of international travel opportunities and a host of other benefits to those that are lucky enough to work there.There is a video explaining who they are and what they do at the bottom of this page.                                       Some years back, I was involved in an accident. I was hit by a car and thrown off my bike at pretty high speed. I flew through the air (stylishly) and landed head first on a kerb stone (a bit less stylishly). I broke my shoulder, smashed my chin, broke a couple of ribs... and if it wasn't for my helmet I would almost certainly have died... or been seriously brain damaged. As planet Earth gets greener and fitter we’re cycling more and more. More than a hundred cities around the world now have cycle rental schemes, which are proving to be hugely popular. But very few of us non bike owners are wearing helmets. According to research, the main reason is that they are simply too cumbersome to carry around all day, especially if you may only be taking a ten minute bike ride.   I noticed that on bike rental schemes, such as the ones in San Francisco, Boston, London,  Paris, Taipei, Shanghai, Bangkok and other cities, huge numbers of cyclists don't wear helmets. In London, for instance, well over 90% of renters don't wear one. I wanted to know why, so I commissioned a survey*. These were the results that we obtained:              *Survey results property of Jeffrey Woolf OBE © 2013So I realised I had a mission. If I could create a helmet that could fold flat… I could save lives, and so my journey began... It’s inevitable that as more people take to the road on a bicycle, more people will have accidents. When head meets road, vehicle or pavement without a helmet on it’s generally pretty messy… and sometimes fatal! My campaign is about encouraging helmet use by making them simpler to carry around when one isn’t actually on a bicycle. Help us protect the world, help get Morpher through the last stages of production.       Morpher has come a long way since its inception. The design has grown and changed radically, ideas have come and gone and now we're almost there. There are just a few more stages to complete before Morpher is ready to meet the world.  Moulding this helmet is extremely difficult as there are least 6 different materials and components involved. And they all have to be combined into one final moulding and assembly operation, which is incredibly challenging and has never been done before!(For those of you that want some more detail of how this all happens, see below or feel free to send me an email.) The funds are going towards passing rigorous international safety standards testing as well as finalising and building the incredibly complex tooling that is needed to produce Morpher. This means ensuring that the helmets get through the hugely onerous and thorough testing criteria to ensure that they pass all relevant safety standards. First for Europe and then for the USA and Australia (Our prototypes have already passed most European testing standards and we are on course to pass the more stringent US and Australian testing requirements).  THE MONEYThe funding will be used to cover the high costs of obtaining the certification and to get the manufacturing process working in an efficient and streamlined way, ready for mass production.  FAQs
1.  Shipping Costs: If you forgot to add shipping to your order then please Click Here, select "No perk, I just want to contribute", change the amount from the default $100 to the correct amount ($10 US, $15 UK or $20 Rest of World) & it will be matched to your order
2.  Shipping Addresses: Before we ship anything we’ll be emailing & asking you to confirm your address, so please don’t worry if you've moved since you ordered
3.  Colours: The first Morphers that we ship don’t have a colour choice. We’ve already polled you on some choices & I think they’ll be stunning. More about this as we get closer to May… It's looking likely that they'll be black (as shown under the "What" section, above) but this isn't yet guaranteed
4.  Size: Our first model has a fit system. This means you can adjust your Morpher to fit heads with a circumference of between 50.5 & 58cm. (19.8 to 22.7 inches. 6 1/8 to 7 1/8 UK hat sizes.) This covers a pretty wide range of heads from mid-teens to small ladies to medium+ men. Obviously, in the future, we'll produce a range of sizes including larger helmets & children's helmets.
 PRESSWe've had recent press in all of these publications, programmes and websites.    
CNET
Business Bee

Share the IndieGoGo link with everyone and help us build momentum.Our Twitter account is @morpherhelmetThis is one of the greatest ways you can help us if you've donated or not. We urge everyone who believes in Morpher to do this!                                            CONTACTIf you wish to get in contact please access our website and drop us an email.http://www.morpherhelmet.com/Here is a video on Strategic Sports Ltd, our manufacturing partner. You could come and visit this factory with me if you purchase our top perk. It's an incredible place to see.    So pick a perk, and together let's make safety more accessible than ever!     Thank You! *Survey results property of Jeffrey Woolf OBE © 2013  This webpage and its content is copyright of Jeffrey Woolf OBE © 2013. All rights reserved.Any redistribution or reproduction of part or all of the contents in any form is prohibited other than the following:you may print or download to a local hard disk extracts for your personal and non-commercial use onlyYou may not, except with my express written permission, distribute, quote or commercially exploit any of the content. story:
Charcoal Chimney

Lid Lifter & Serving Stand

 

Smoker

Grill

Pizza Oven

Steamer

Griddle

 

Camping and Outdoor Adventures – the entire system allows for much more creative gourmet meal options in addition to just cooking in a Dutch Oven. Frying on the griddle provides an additional use for your Dutch oven lid.

Trading Posts, Leave-no-Trace Advocates – CampMaid designs all products with this goal in mind which is why troop leaders and scout trainers have voiced tremendous accolades about these new and exciting leave-no-trace outdoors cooking products.

Scouts - Teaching our youth the importance of leaving the smallest footprint in our environment as possible is a top priority for Scout Troops.

Beach Cookouts, BBQ in Parks, Picnics, Backyards – CampMaid’s goal is to allow everyone to cook anywhere, safely and efficiently. The features like CampMaid’s Pizza Oven are a family favorite and the hit of the party at any family/friends event.

Survival, Emergency Preparedness, Off-the-Grid – Experienced preppers know how important it is to be able to not only survive, but thrive in a disaster scenario that includes loss of power and gas. With the CampMaid Grab-and-Go Complete Outdoor Cooking System you can cook anything, anywhere, with any fuel source. 

Hunting and Fishing - Quiet, lightweight and portable is key for hunting and fishing. Being able to smoke your meats and fish right after being caught is easy and efficient.

Backpacking, River Running, Back-country – the goal is to pack the least amount of lightweight gear, especially cooking options. Leaving the heavy Dutch oven at home, you can just take the lightweight Flip Grill with the Grab-and-Hold device, which turns your cooking options into a portable smoker and grill. 

Tailgating, Sports Gatherings, RV Parks, Off-road Adventure – At sports gatherings the focus should be on the game, not inconvenient cooking so CampMaid’s system makes it easy for fans to throw the entire Outdoor Cooking System in-a-bag in your truck and show up at the party ready to quickly cook. Breaking down to get to the game on time has never been quicker, easier, cleaner and more compact.

READY TO SHIP!

"As owner/publisher of Disaster Survival Magazine I get to review many preparedness products and survival gear and I must say this is one of the best outdoor cooking/camping/portable gear I have ever owned." - Vincent VonDoom

"You how it is when it comes to setting up a barbie: setting up the fire is a painstaking process and this handsome little guy, called Charcoal Chimney by CampMaid, is here to alleviate that pain READ MORE"

story:
Solpro has partnered with the technology leaders in Bluetooth™ tracking, solar cell technology, and smartphone cases. The result is Tag. Credit card sized, extremely light and uses next generation USB technology.

 

    Ditch the brick: We listened to our customers and they wanted a smaller, lighter battery pack that they could take anywhere. It had to look great, be easy to use, and be light as a feather.

    Simple solar charging: Another problem we wanted to solve was charging. We included one of the highest efficiency solar cells available on the market, made by SunPower. 

    Keep powered on the go: By simply hanging the Solpro Tag on your bag you can charge anywhere. At the café, during lunch, or walking back and forth from your car. 

    Ready for the future: The next generation of USB technology is the USB-C specification. Tag’s twin USB-C dual-role charging ports are ready for tomorrow’s devices and the included USB-A adapter lets you use any of your legacy cables.

    Protected from the elements: If you are going to hang a battery off your bag then you don’t want to worry about water or dust getting in there. That’s why we designed the Bumper to make it easy to hang Tag anywhere while providing port plugs that protect it from water and dust.

    It's simple. Use Tag just like any other battery pack. Charge it via USB to fill the battery and then use it to recharge your mobile devices.

    Catch some rays: Charge Tag with its built-in solar panel. You can grab almost 200mAh per hour from the sun. This means that one hour of sun charge equals approximately 10% extra battery life for most popular smartphones. Solar energy is free energy, anywhere, anytime. When your phone is hovering around 0% that energy is a lifesaver!

    Won't weigh you down: Tag weighs less than 2 ounces and will keep your phone going the rest of the day.

    Plus, it doesn't fill up your bag since you can hang it outside. This means you never have to go diving to the bottom of your bag trying to fish out your battery pack.

    • Weighs less than 2 ounces
    • Twin USB C dual-role ports
    • High efficiency solar cells by SunPower
    • Enabled with TrackR technology

    Find your bag, find your car, and find your phone: Tag is also a bluetooth tracker that works with the TrackR app. We have partnered with the technology leader in Bluetooth™ tracking: TrackR.

     

    TrackR has sold over 6 million devices, offers near global coverage, and is releasing the TrackR Atlas to provide even more precise tracking capability in the home.

    Additionally, even when the internal battery is "dead" Tag will still have enough juice remaining to power the internal TrackR Bluetooth module for up to 1 YEAR.

     

    We also showed Tag to our awesome friends at OtterBox. With their support we developed a holster for their uniVERSE case system. If you have an iPhone and want a solar powered battery boost, simply attach the Holster to your case and Tag slides right in. You’ll be able to charge your iPhone and still have one free USB-C port to charge any of your other devices.

     

    We need to raise $28,800 for tooling and the first production run.  

    We’ve sweetened the deal by creating some really great perks. You can get just the Tag, the full bundle, a family pack, and even a B2B pack. Check them out!

    When the campaign ends you'll receive a survey. You can choose your color: orange, black or gray. Plus, you can upgrade or add more cables, bumpers, or adapters thanks to BackerKit.

    Famous last words: “we’ve done this before and don’t foresee any problems”. We’ve all heard that before. Then, all of a sudden, there is something that goes wrong that was completely off the radar. 

    For the most part, everything we’re doing is in our wheelhouse. Battery packs, solar panels, and USB are technologies we work with and produce every day. However, there are some interesting quirks to USB-C as well as some other questions.

    • How does the dual role port know if it needs to give a charge or take a charge?
    • Can you really connect a single cable to both ports and not have the battery charge itself in an endless cycle?
    • Are there any issues with the Bluetooth integration and will the RF noise impede any of the other functions?
    • Will we be able to make a holster for the uniVERSE case with USB-C and a lightning connector that is MFi certified?

    We’ve done our homework and firmly believe we have solutions to all the questions that adhere to both the USB-C 3.0 and MFi specifications.

    Press contact: press@solpro.com

story:
Help us Free Pride

Last year Glasgow Pride charged an entry fee to participate, and this year it is charging even more, but not all LGBTQIA+ can afford this. The event lacks inclusiveness for everyone in our LGBTQIA+ community with people feeling uncomfortable and unsafe at the event. The event has lost its political edge and fails to meet the needs of those in the community who need us to stand together and demand change.

The wholesale commercialisation of pride makes it clear that we need an alternative- we're tired of being patronized and marketed to by large companies, we're tired of having our histories pink-washed, we're tired of the exclusion of trans, non-binary, disabled, poor, non-white and other marginalised identities and we're tired of the real issues facing our community being swept under the rug.

So this year we will be holding our own event. One that is not commercialised. One that is inclusive. One that is a protest. We will be freeing pride and we want you to join us!


What We Need 

We want to spread the word amongst the LGBTQIA+ community, and organise an event which is free and inclusive. All donations will contribute towards:

  • Venue- We are holding both a day time and night time events in an accessible city center venue, where we will have performances, stalls, workshops, film screenings and discussions, celebrating LGBTQIA+ struggles and discussing the best ways to combat continuing oppression. We have been quoted £570 for the use of the venue.          
  • Promotional materials- flyers, posters and badges will all help us spread the word. We will also print large print accessible copies. £50 
  • BSL interpreters- We aim to provide adjustments that will allow everyone to participate such as BSL interpreters. Full day cost for two interpreters £240.     
  • Equipment and performer costs- We want the event to be inclusive of everyone including the performers/speakers, so we aim to cover necessary travel costs and will provide refreshments. £150 

(Due to the nature of event organising this list may not be exhaustive, but we will publish a list of expenditure on our social media pages shortly after the event.)


What we hope to achieve 

In addition to providing the community an accessible, inclusive and enjoyable event, we hope to provide an example to Pride Glasgow of what a de-commercialised pride looks like. We want to campaign for the necessary changes to Pride Glasgow while providing an alternative that the community can enjoy now. 


Other Ways You Can Help

We are inivte all LGBTQIA+ people in Glasgow to get involved in Free Pride by coming to our meetings, organizing an event or fundraiser, offering a skill such as design or performance, or just showing support on Facebook and attending our events.

story:
Our City Vagabond team created a comfortable urban backpack with a unique design. We’re convinced that backpacks must be versatile, to look appropriate both in the office and at the parties and express its owner’s individuality. We’re all very excited to present a true Superhero Backpack and to see how you make use of its powers.

There is a puzzle in our page: one can find some signs which are building a secret word up. If you managed to figure it out, please share your versions here.
The smartest vagabonds will get a super-secret discount!

Superhero backpack is your perfect urban buddy, which is both aesthetically pleasing and endlessly practical. Hard shell is water- and damage-resistant. For your IDs and plastic cards there are easily accessible pockets on one of the straps and facets. As a bonus, you can clip badges on the magnetic facet.


We wanted everyone to feel comfortable when wearing Superhero backpack, so we’ve designed a breathable ergonomic back for the hottest days. In addition to that basic version of the backpack contains interior pockets for everything you might need: laptop, papers, water bottles, chargers, pens, keys. As a little superhero secret, we’ve also added two discreet exterior pockets which are easy to access without taking the backpack off.

If basic version of the backpack is not enough for all your needs, we came up with interchangeable layers that have extra pockets for your gadgets, documents or a camera. They easily clip on and off and remain in place throughout the wildest adventures.

For now we’re only shipping the basic model, but we’ll notify you once layers come out. Currently next options are in production:

 

The most important task for us was to make Superhero backpack unique for everyone, so we found ways to make it as customisable as possible. The shell can be painted or decorated with special facet stickers. For the interior we offer a choice of materials: regular fabric or a velvet-like flock. We’ll contact you to ask which one you prefer.

In the past our team successfully launched a project for the nixie tube clock VacuumGlow, which received a prestigious A'design Award in April. Now, we couldn’t be happier to work on another designer project, City Vagabond.

We’re a team of unique individuals from different backgrounds and with different lifestyles and we wanted to create a backpack with the versatility to match. From artsy hipsters to busy office workers, we all contributed to make this product as unique as it is.

For your convenience, we’ve created a FAQ.

There is also an online-chat for all of your not-so-frequently asked questions.

 

If you’re not big on chats, there’s always good ol’ fashioned email for your enquires and proposals: 

If you’re a distributor, we have perks for you! Please contact us at  info@cityvagabond.net  for details.

To learn more about Сity Vagabond  click our press kit. We’re open to cooperation and willing to share information. Please contact us at for  info@cityvagabond.net  details.

Our team is super grateful for your support!

We’re all very excited to present a true Superhero Backpack and to see how you make use of its powers.There is a puzzle in our page: one can find some signs which are building a secret word up. story:
Hello Everyone,

My name is Jacy Jacobson and I am about to graduate from Western State College in Gunnison, Colorado. In December I will graduate and then travel to Africa with my boyfriend and his family. I am provided with the amazing opportunity to travel and see parts of the world that not many people will get the chance to visit. 

 

I am graduating with an Art degree and have always enjoyed painting, drawing, and photographing the things that I see around me. I am hoping that this campaign will help me further promote and develop my art. I am very excited about the opportunity to sell my artwork and be able to travel and see more gorgeous and amazing things.  I know this will be an eye-opening experience that will present us both with possibilities and opportunities in and out of the field of art.

 

What I Need & What You Get

I am trying to raise money to support myself for 1 month in Africa, 3 months in Europe and still have a little bit to survive on when I arrive back home. If we do some quick math: With a successful campaign I will receive 96% of the final amount raised since IndieGoGo takes 4%. With $6,000 raised that leaves me at around $5,600 after fees and all. After paying for shipping to send all of you beautiful people your perks I am thinking I will be at around $5,000. With a budget of $250 a week for 16 weeks, that leaves me with a little extra for activities, site seeing, etc.

 

What you get for contributing is up to you. As you can see on the right I have a lot of perks and most of them involve my artwork, from a calendar with my photos to a water color painting of a picture that I took on the trip. Help me make a living on what I love do to. Art.  You can also support our (Terry and Myself) love for the outdoors by claiming the perk-Slackline or Climb for a day!!!

 

The Impact

By contributing to the campaign you are helping me develop, practice and build confidence for my artwork. Since a life without art is not much of a life at all, you are also encouraging me to fulfill my dream of incorporating art into all parts of this world.

 

The biggest impact is helping me gauge how popular my artwork is, and how likely I am to be able to sell it once Terry and I get back to the US.  I know there will always be room for improvement and development so please let me know what you think.  Any and all comments and thoughts would be greatly appreciated!!

 

Other Ways to Help

If you can’t contribute due to funds, I completely understand. And there are other ways to help! Terry and I are still looking for places to stay on our route from Barcelona to France, Italy, Switzerland, Austria, Germany and back to Paris. We are looking for free camping, cheap hostels and friends of friends that would be willing to have us stay for a few nights. Any information helps!

story:
Introducing Funstatic - the first travel map that clings to any flat surface with no wall damage.

This Travel Map is a unique and beautifully designed piece of art that clings to the wall allowing you to build your personal travel story. Funstatic can effortlessly be added, removed or repositioned without damaging your wall.

It’s an easy, dynamic and fun way to decorate any wall or flat surface with your custom photos without leaving holes, marks, or removing paint.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Due to the map's interactive properties, your map can always be smoothly moved wherever your intentions take it. In other words, you can reposition the parts whenever you like.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Funstatic has the fastest application time, within seconds you can peel it from the liner, place it on the surface and the electrostatic charges will do the rest!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Since Funstatic was designed to avoid the need for adhesives, nails, and tapes, it is impossible to damage your walls even if you really wanted to!

Funstatic clings to all kinds of flat surfaces, making it the most versatile decoration for your home.

Why not save your best and craziest travel memories?  You have the option to add your top 10 favorite custom photos to your map. We will print them and ship them to your doorstep with your travel map.

Steps for receiving your custom photos

Can I write notes on my photos or map?

YES, you can! There is a blank space beneath each photo for you to write. When you have returned home from your holiday, you can mark off the visited country by coloring the title.

Funstatic comes with a super cool travel planner so you can add destinations to your travel bucket list.

When you return home, you can tick those destinations off your checklist.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Funstatic comes in 2 sizes: Medium (125x75cm) and Large (155x95cm). So, regardless of the size of your space, we've got your walls covered!

Funstatic is made from Polypropylene, this means it can be recycled into new products. So make sure you dispose of it in the correct place.

Most photos, posters and other wall decorations will often damage or leave marks on your walls, leaving you having to repair or repaint the walls later.

People have tried several solutions over time but none of them were damage-free for their walls.

Carefully printed on an innovative electrically charged film, the travel map can cling to any flat surface.

It’s known that equal charges repel each other and different charges are attracted to one another.

Due to the negative charge on the printed material and the positive charge on the wall, the map and photos can be easily applied without the need for harmful adhesives.

 

Funstatic will be shipped worldwide. Here are the shipping costs:

The team is composed of 3 engineers from Portugal who share the passion for product development and innovation.

We decided to come up with this idea after one of us had to move apartments. During the process of moving, he discovered how frustrating it was to attach and detach the travel photos and posters without damaging the walls. Therefore, he ended up spending money on repairing the damage whilst still holding the risk of losing the rent deposit.

We knew there had to be a better way.

We put our minds together and we found several alternative materials, like magnetic paint, but they just weren't the answer we were looking for and none of them was necessarily fun and good enough to avoid wall damage.

After learning about the electrostatic effects on a Polypropylene film, we decided to research further and design it in the shape of a world map.

Why Indiegogo?

Although this is not our first product, it is the first time we launch a campaign on Kickstarter.

On every product we develop, we try to have the public validation before definitive producing, hence, reducing the risk.

Also, we want to keep developing products alongside our customers. With your support, we can focus on what is important to you.

For those reasons, we consider that Indiegogo is the ideal platform for us. 

Risks and challenges

Having made a successful prototype of our product, we know that the product works and we ready to make it with the same quality on a larger scale.

However, it depends on the supply chain. This means that some parts of the production will not be under our control. Some mistakes can happen such as mixing materials, power shortages and machines failing. If that would be the case, we promise full transparency. You will be informed of every step of the process.

Shipping is always a risk. We know from experience that some orders disappear, get damaged or are not delivered on the promised date. Any time that happened before, we never let the customer pay for other’s mistakes. We intend to keep it that way.

In case you have questions, feel free to reach out to us at info@funstatic.eu and we will be happy to assist you.

FAQs

Q: How long does the static charge last? A: The duration of the “clinginess” is linked to many factors, including surface area, external environment, dust levels, and the texture of the wall. Funstatic stick for longer in dry, temperate, dust-free environments. In ideal conditions, Funstatic can cling to your wall for several months or even years.

Q: Can I recharge my Travel Map/Photos? A: Some of the charge can be restored. Simply rub the map/photos onto fabrics or hair and stick it to the wall.

Q: What is Funstatic made of? A: We use an electrostatically charged polypropylene film, which is a recyclable thermoplastic polymer.

Q: Is Funstatic recyclable? A: Yes. Our film is considered a plastic of category 5. This means it is 100% recyclable. Also, the liner can be recycled along with the standard paper.

Q: Is Funstatic water-resistant? A: Funstatic loses part of the charge in wet conditions, it is not recommended to use it in wet/moist environments (e.g. bathrooms).

Q: Can I use Funstatic outside? A: We do not recommend to use Funstatic outside since the static charge is very sensitive to wind and humidity.

Q: Can I write on Funstatic? A: Absolutely! You can use any writing utensils, although we recommend using ballpoint pens, permanent markers, or erasable pens. We do not recommend gel pens, due to its longer time to dry and hence, the risk of dripping.

Note: Alcohol-based markers can damage the surface and are more difficult to erase.

Q: Is Funstatic repositionable? How often can it be moved? A: Yes, you can reposition Funstatic. However, the fewer times it is moved the longer it stays on a surface.

Q: What is the shelf life of printed Funstatic? A: One year if it is wrapped and stored in a clean dry location.

story:
2 Brits cycling 250 miles for our Nepali friends who've lost homes, jobs and loved ones

Hi guys. As most of you probably know, James and I were lucky enough to go to Nepal last year to trek to Everest base camp.

Unfortunately the earthquakes that hit Nepal this year have hurt many of the friends we made there. They are mostly from a region west of Kathmandu called Gorkha, which as you might have seen was the epicentre of the first quake. 

The damage was pretty catastrophic. 90% of the buildings in the region were destroyed or seriously damaged. 43 employees of the company we trekked with have lost their homes. 35 schools were destroyed. The almost complete shutdown of the tourist industry meant the overwhelming majority have been out of work for almost 4 months. And that doesn't even mention the 64 loved ones that were killed and injured. For much of the last 3 months our friends and many others have been living in tents and surviving off charity handouts. This is not the beautiful Nepal we saw and fell in love with.

We thought we'd try and raise a bit of cash for them, so in the name of charity (and never having to do another leg day) we're looking to bike 250 miles from Manchester to Edinburgh. I hope I don't need to point out that this is a pretty massive mission, particularly given that one of us was in hospital having lung surgery 3 months ago! We're hoping to make it in 3 days, and promise to upload pics of every beautiful view, impressive sight, and emotional breakdown on the way.

We'd really appreciate it if you would consider donating. The money is going in part directly to the bank accounts of some of our friends there who've lost their homes, and in part to a charity called Sambhav Nepal. Sambhav means 'it's possible' in Nepalese. The charity was set up by the CEO of the trekking company we went with to improve the schools and education in Gorkha, although currently they are more focussed on just enabling the community to get back on its feet. In the 2 months after the earthquake they distributed almost 4000 aluminium sheets and 27,000 kg of rice to those in need. But much more is required.

If anyone wants more information on how the money will be used, please go to www.sambhavnepal.org to see details of their educational projects and ongoing relief work. We particularly recommend the videos. And if anyone has any further questions about where the money is going, please don't hesitate to get in touch with us.

story:
In order to get our first season of tours off the ground, we're cycling on our balcony 24-hours-a-day for two weeks! 

*** WATCH US LIVE: www.bikeabouteurope.com/indiegogo ***

Hey, we’re Bren and Chad. 

A little over two years ago, after moving from Australia to Spain (Chad) and the U.K. (Bren), and after having barely ridden a bike since we were kids, we decided to dust off our stack-hats and ride the length of Spain's Mediterranean coastline.

Would we make it? Would we hate it? Would be even still be brothers by the end of it?

Starting at the southern-most tip of the european continent, in Tarifa, we rode all the way along the spanish coast to the beautiful city of Barcelona.

21 days and 1,200km in total. And, you know what? We were HOOKED! 

Later that year Bren took a ride from Brussels to Amsterdam. 

Early in 2012, Chad popped over to Portugal and rode from Faro, back across the spanish border, to his home base in Málaga.

Bren caught the bug again not long after, called in sick for a week at work, and cycled from Berlin down to Prague. 

In June 2012, we re-united again in Prague and continued the ride down through the Czech Republic into Austria and then over to Munich, in southern Germany. 

And this year, in preparation for our first official season of tours in 2014, we carried out a range of practice tours, complete with hired van, new bikes and, most importantly, guests.

Throughout all of these trips, we've plotted the routes that we've ridden with one goal in mind; to open up the incredible experience of cycling across a country (or a continent!) to as many people as possible, from all around the world! 

WHAT WE’RE DOING NOW

Over the last two years, as well as getting some miles in our legs and some knowledge up our sleeves, we’ve also been planning the much-anticipated launch of Bike About Europe and our first ever season of tours in 2014! 

All the boring bits of registering the company, setting up bank accounts and organising insurance, have now been taken care of. We've launched our beautiful website with a full list of 2014 tours at: www.bikeabouteurope.com

And finally, we’ve put together a comprehensive business plan and we’ve worked out how much we’ll need to spend and when we’ll need to spend it, in order to be able to offer a range of incredible cycling holidays to guests from across the globe in 2014.

WHAT WE NEED NEXT

Obviously the cost of setting up this whole operation is going to be fairly extensive, however we are keen to keep the price of our tours as low as possible for our guests throughout our first year of operation.

By securing a bunch of support and early-bird bookings, we'll have the funds we need to purchase things like our Bike About Europe van, trailer and bicycle fleet. 

With the right support for this campaign, we will be able to offer high-quality, fully-guided cycling holidays all across Europe, at the cheapest possible prices in 2014. 

We've set a modest Indiegogo goal in order to ensure that we receive as much of the funds raised through this campaign as possible. Indiegogo keeps just 4% if we reach our goal, however this jumps to 9% if we don't.

By contributing a small amount to the campaign, you'll be making a big difference to help us bring this fantastic form of travel to many more people over the next 12 months. 

By making a larger contribution you can secure an unforgettable 2014 European Cycling Holiday at a significantly discounted rate (up to 40% off, depending on your contribution) and become one of the first people ever to sign up for an amazing Bike About Europe adventure.

FUNDRAISING TARGETS

This campaign is not so much about targets as it is about offering innovative perks and fantastic discounts to our earliest supporters. It's also about having access to the funds we need to keep our prices down throughout our first season of tours!

The graphic below gives you an idea of what we'll be able to purchase, based on varying levels of success throughout our campaign. 

As you can see, every pound, dollar, euro or yen that is donated will help to ensure that Bike About Europe gets off the the flying start that we're hoping for over the next 12 months!

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

We understand that not everyone can afford to make a financial donation to help us get Bike About Europe off the ground, but never fear; there are tons of other ways that you can help! Check out these ideas, for example:

  • Share the campaign: Use the social media links under our campaign video at the top of this page to share the campaign with friends and family. 
  • Like us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/bikeabouteurope 
  • Follow us on Twitter: www.twitter.com/bikeabouteurope
  • Check out the live feed: Drop in to www.bikeabouteurope.com/indiegogo to see us cycling on our balcony in Spain throughout the duration of the campaign (1 October - 14 October, 2013).
  • Mention us to that friend with a blog: Any links back to the campaign are good news for us. If you happen to know somebody who works at a newspaper, writes articles online, or just seems to love sharing stuff with people they know, send 'em our way - we'd love to hear from them!
  • Check out our 2014 tours: You may not have your 2014 travel plans locked in yet and therefore don't want to commit to booking your holiday too early, however while you're sorting things out, feel free to visit www.bikeabouteurope.com to check out the available tours for 2014. Also, pass on the website details to friends and family who may be interested in a cycling holiday on their next European adventure!

£25+ PERK: BICYCLE KEYCHAIN BOTTLE OPENER

Most of our perks are fairly self-explanatory, however this one requires a few small photos to appreciate it's coolness! So, here they are:

This perk is included with every contribution of £25 or more, so please ensure to include your shipping address so that we can post this out to you at the end of the campaign. 

Note: International shipping of this item is included with all contributions of £25 or more.

IMPORTANT NOTE

By contributing to this campaign you are purchasing a voucher which is redeemable for the corresponding discount or number of tours which are applicable to your particular contribution, rather than purchasing a tour directly. The legal folks tell us that this is an important distinction, and will help to make sure that our discounts are as generous as possible!

To read the full 'Terms and Conditions' for Bike About Europe bookings please visit: www.bikeabouteurepe.com/terms-and-conditions

Thanks very much for all the support!
story_txt:
In order to get our first season of tours off the ground, we're cycling on our balcony 24-hours-a-day for two weeks! 

*** WATCH US LIVE: www.bikeabouteurope.com/indiegogo ***











Hey, we’re Bren and Chad. 








A little over two years ago, after moving from Australia to Spain (Chad) and the U.K. (Bren), and after having barely ridden a bike since we were kids, we decided to dust off our stack-hats and ride the length of Spain's Mediterranean coastline.
Would we make it? Would we hate it? Would be even still be brothers by the end of it?
Starting at the southern-most tip of the european continent, in Tarifa, we rode all the way along the spanish coast to the beautiful city of Barcelona.



21 days and 1,200km in total. And, you know what? We were HOOKED! 
Later that year Bren took a ride from Brussels to Amsterdam. 



Early in 2012, Chad popped over to Portugal and rode from Faro, back across the spanish border, to his home base in Málaga.



Bren caught the bug again not long after, called in sick for a week at work, and cycled from Berlin down to Prague. 



In June 2012, we re-united again in Prague and continued the ride down through the Czech Republic into Austria and then over to Munich, in southern Germany. 




And this year, in preparation for our first official season of tours in 2014, we carried out a range of practice tours, complete with hired van, new bikes and, most importantly, guests.






Throughout all of these trips, we've plotted the routes that we've ridden with one goal in mind; to open up the incredible experience of cycling across a country (or a continent!) to as many people as possible, from all around the world! 


WHAT WE’RE DOING NOW
Over the last two years, as well as getting some miles in our legs and some knowledge up our sleeves, we’ve also been planning the much-anticipated launch of Bike About Europe and our first ever season of tours in 2014! 



All the boring bits of registering the company, setting up bank accounts and organising insurance, have now been taken care of. We've launched our beautiful website with a full list of 2014 tours at: www.bikeabouteurope.com
And finally, we’ve put together a comprehensive business plan and we’ve worked out how much we’ll need to spend and when we’ll need to spend it, in order to be able to offer a range of incredible cycling holidays to guests from across the globe in 2014.



WHAT WE NEED NEXT
Obviously the cost of setting up this whole operation is going to be fairly extensive, however we are keen to keep the price of our tours as low as possible for our guests throughout our first year of operation.
By securing a bunch of support and early-bird bookings, we'll have the funds we need to purchase things like our Bike About Europe van, trailer and bicycle fleet. 
With the right support for this campaign, we will be able to offer high-quality, fully-guided cycling holidays all across Europe, at the cheapest possible prices in 2014. 





We've set a modest Indiegogo goal in order to ensure that we receive as much of the funds raised through this campaign as possible. Indiegogo keeps just 4% if we reach our goal, however this jumps to 9% if we don't.
By contributing a small amount to the campaign, you'll be making a big difference to help us bring this fantastic form of travel to many more people over the next 12 months. 
By making a larger contribution you can secure an unforgettable 2014 European Cycling Holiday at a significantly discounted rate (up to 40% off, depending on your contribution) and become one of the first people ever to sign up for an amazing Bike About Europe adventure.



FUNDRAISING TARGETS
This campaign is not so much about targets as it is about offering innovative perks and fantastic discounts to our earliest supporters. It's also about having access to the funds we need to keep our prices down throughout our first season of tours!
The graphic below gives you an idea of what we'll be able to purchase, based on varying levels of success throughout our campaign. 



As you can see, every pound, dollar, euro or yen that is donated will help to ensure that Bike About Europe gets off the the flying start that we're hoping for over the next 12 months!



OTHER WAYS TO HELP

We understand that not everyone can afford to make a financial donation to help us get Bike About Europe off the ground, but never fear; there are tons of other ways that you can help! Check out these ideas, for example:



Share the campaign: Use the social media links under our campaign video at the top of this page to share the campaign with friends and family. 

Like us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/bikeabouteurope 

Follow us on Twitter: www.twitter.com/bikeabouteurope


Check out the live feed: Drop in to www.bikeabouteurope.com/indiegogo to see us cycling on our balcony in Spain throughout the duration of the campaign (1 October - 14 October, 2013).

Mention us to that friend with a blog: Any links back to the campaign are good news for us. If you happen to know somebody who works at a newspaper, writes articles online, or just seems to love sharing stuff with people they know, send 'em our way - we'd love to hear from them!


Check out our 2014 tours: You may not have your 2014 travel plans locked in yet and therefore don't want to commit to booking your holiday too early, however while you're sorting things out, feel free to visit www.bikeabouteurope.com to check out the available tours for 2014. Also, pass on the website details to friends and family who may be interested in a cycling holiday on their next European adventure!





£25+ PERK: BICYCLE KEYCHAIN BOTTLE OPENER
Most of our perks are fairly self-explanatory, however this one requires a few small photos to appreciate it's coolness! So, here they are:



This perk is included with every contribution of £25 or more, so please ensure to include your shipping address so that we can post this out to you at the end of the campaign. 
Note: International shipping of this item is included with all contributions of £25 or more.






IMPORTANT NOTE
By contributing to this campaign you are purchasing a voucher which is redeemable for the corresponding discount or number of tours which are applicable to your particular contribution, rather than purchasing a tour directly. The legal folks tell us that this is an important distinction, and will help to make sure that our discounts are as generous as possible!
To read the full 'Terms and Conditions' for Bike About Europe bookings please visit: www.bikeabouteurepe.com/terms-and-conditions
Thanks very much for all the support!

story:
Climbing for Syrian Women

Mobilizing Syrian Women Civil Defense

Hello my name is Lena and on February 14th 2015 I will attempt to reach the top of Mount Kilimanjaro— the highest mountain in Africa and the tallest freestanding peak in the world.

I am climbing this 5,895 meter-high mountain for a cause that is very personal to me. My every step up Kilimanjaro will be for Syria and for my two elderly grandmothers there. As a Syrian American, I am not able to go inside the country to help, but I am able to help young Syrian women like me who can.

These young women are the volunteers of the White Helmets inside Syria. They are search-and-rescue workers and medics responding to bombings and chemical attacks. Together we share a vision: to restore and maintain hope in Syria. They work inside the country on the founding principles of “impartiality, humanity and neutrality”, underpinning a promise to all Syrians that the White Helmets are there to provide safety to everyone in a time of need, regardless of what side of the conflict they stand. From now leading up to my climb in February, I am asking for your support in joining the mission of raising awareness and saving lives in Syria by helping these White Helmet volunteers.

Despite Syria being one of the most dangerous places on earth, the White Helmets continue to operate and risk their lives to save others. Some days there are more than 50 bombs and mortars that land in Syrian neighborhoods. Many of these bombs are rusty barrels filled with nails and explosives, and sometimes are also filled with lethal chemicals, that are dropped from helicopters onto homes, schools and hospitals.

The women volunteers are vital to saving lives during some of these tragedies, especially the lives of women and girls. In the most conservative areas of Syria, the communities and women themselves prefer being rescued by other women. This is usually the case following major blasts where clothes are ripped-off upon impact. Bare women have refused to be seen or even saved by male volunteers from the White Helmets in their time of need.

For this reason the White Helmets have led a campaign to bring more young women civil defenders on board. Since September 35 young and courageous Syrian women have been trained in search-and-rescue and medical aid to save other women and men, and now, there is a total of 56 women in Syria helping. These women are already saving lives, but are in need of some basic necessities to help them reach more people. Currently, these women are in need of 6 ambulances in Syria. YOU and I will attempt to provide them ONE of these ambulances for the cost ofUSD $15,000.


Having more women as civil defenders— trained and on the streets of Syria – hits close to home for me. With my conservative grandmothers inside Damascus, I want to know they will be safe and rescued if they were in a time of need. Getting more Syrian women involved in protecting and defending Syria, working alongside our Syrian men, will shape the future of the country and the role of our women in it.  

With each small step we take together, through donations or sharing this story, we are closer to reaching the top of the mountain, whether its Mount Kilimanjaro, or more so the challenge of helping Syrian White Helmet women save more lives and restore the country.

If you would like to follow our hike in February, you can follow us on this blog (https://climbingforsyria.wordpress.com/). We will also be updating this site weekly leading up to the climb with training updates and news from the women White Helmets.


Thank you,

Lena A.

100% of your donation will go to the women White Helmet's ambulance. 


في شهر شباط (فبراير) 2015 سوف نقوم معاً بتسلقجبل كليمنجارو،والذي يعتبر الجبل الأكثر ارتفاعا في أفريقيا, و من خلال هذا التحدي سنظهر إلتزامنا تجاه النساء السوريات اللواتي يقمن بانقاذ حياة السوريين يومياً.

تلك النساء الشابات اللواتي تطوعن للعمل مع ذوي القبعات البيضاء، والذين يعملون كعاملاتٍ للبحث والإنقاذ، وهن المسعفات الأقوياء اللواتي لبين نداءات الاستغاثة أيضاً عند القصف بالمدفعية الثقيلة و بالأسلحة الكيماوية والتفجيرات الأخرى.

حالياً هنالك 56 امرأة في سوريا يسعون الى إنقاذ الأطفال و النساء و الرجال في حال وقوع تلك المهالك, بالرغم من أنهن يحافظن على حياة الإنسان السوري , فهن بأمس الحاجة لإيصال و تقديم المساعدة للمزيد من الناس عن طريق سيارات الإسعاف, و لهذا السبب كانوا قد طلبن 6 سيارات اسعاف لتغطية عملهن حول سوريا.

و مع هذه الحملة و انطلاقا من جهودنا المشتركة , سوف نقوم بجمع مبلغ 15000 دولار وهي ثمن سيارة اسعاف واحدة فقط من أصل الـ 6سيارات المطلوبة.

نرجوا دعمكم قدر المستطاع سواء عن طريق المشاركة في نشر هذا الحملة أو مساعدتنا مالياً حتى نصل الى هدفنا الإنساني ولكي تحصل نساء القبعات البيضاء على سيارات الإسعاف المطلوبة للحفاظ على المزيد من حياةالشعب السوري.

شاكرين دعمكم ومساعدتكم.
